isis.stitle: 7 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS FULLER SERIES - REASSEMBLE - COUNTERSHAFT

note.para: Since left and right countershaft assemblies are identical, reassembly of each is performed in the same manner.

step1.para: If previously removed, install the key in the keyway of the countershaft ( Figure 96).

figure.caption: Figure 96. Install Key in Countershaft Keyway

step1.para: Align the keyway of the gear with the key in the countershaft and press 4th speed gear onto position on the shaft, long hub of the gear to the front of the countershaft ( Figure 97).

figure.caption: Figure 97. Press 4th Speed Gear into Position

step1.para: Press the 5th speed gear on the countershaft against the 4th speed gear ( Figure 98).

figure.caption: Figure 98. Press 5th Speed Gear on Countershaft

step1.para: Press the 6th speed gear on the countershaft, long hub of the gear toward the front of the countershaft ( Figure 99).

figure.caption: Figure 99. Press 6th Speed Gear on Countershaft

step1.para: Press drive gear on the countershaft, long hub of gear toward 6th speed gear ( Figure 100).

figure.caption: Figure 100. Press Drive Gear on Countershaft

step1.para: Install snap ring in the groove nearest the drive gear ( Figure 101).

figure.caption: Figure 101. Install Snap Ring in Groove Nearest Drive Gear

step1.para: Mark the countershaft drive gear for timing ( Figure 102). On the drive gear of each countershaft assembly, mark the gear tooth stamped with an "O." This tooth is aligned with the keyway in the gear (inset).

figure.caption: Figure 102. Mark Countershaft Drive Gear For Timing
